title: Metadata in Production
description:
Problem is metadata which created by factories during production.

This Metada needs to be 'Collect - Evaluate - Keep in secure for years '

f6_assessments.q0: Recording factory and production data is a great idea. It would be better if the proposer gave more information of what the uses for this data are. I have experience with big data from the real world as a Chief Data Scientist at a prop-tech firm. Collecting and recording the data is only a start, there needs to be a plan for usage of this data and a clear explanation of why it all needs to be immutable.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent discusses collecting what will amount to enormous amounts of real time data. This cannot work be done manually yet there is no discussion of a plan for automating this. The proposer should pick a specific type of factory they which to make a minimum viable product on and detail what sensors they are going to use to collect the data and who they will reliably integrate this into the blockchain. This is no small task even for one factory. Do you need to install new sensor or can you piggy-back on data already collected? For instance in the built environment large amount of data are already generated an used by building management systems. It is much cheaper to tap into these than install new sensors. Many pieces of equipment in factories will also generate data in their operation.
f6_assessments.q2: What does success look like in this project? Even if you collect the data you want, why is that data useful? Why would a factory want it. It would be great to see in addition to a firm plan to automate and collect data, a use case which a factor or end customer of products from that factory would use the data for and include production of an analysis suite which can query the block chain for the data and produce reports.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does in fact successfully address the challenge of utilizing metadata on Cardano by intergrating the metadata in Cardano transactions for utilization by 3rd party auditors as per the regulation of the country of origin.
f6_assessments.q1:
This project is very ambitious and and huge potential is successful, however it is leaving a few key pieces of information out. It would be great it the voter knew the suppliers references in "Demo application will be created and first trial will be done. First trial will be shared with Global customers. Their feedbacks will be collected." - It is unclear exactly what this means and lacks a few specifics. 

Also, the relevant experience section is lacking in specifics to who exactly the proposer worked for and how relevant this is to the proposal itself.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is clearly lacking in specifics i.e. who they are partnered with, the teams experience is incredibly vague and it's hard to measure the success given the lack of specifics in the timeline as presented.

f6_assessments.q0: I think is a great proposal and the need for this type of technology is essential, but we live in a word where companies wont necessarily post their internal processes out for the world to see, is hard to see it used the way described.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer reveals experience withing the production side of it but the technical expertise is not present. It appears that once funded it will hire developers to work towards that goal rather than having an individual with experience in Solidity or Plutus to work on the blockchain side of it.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the proposer has provided most of the information relevant for a good project scope as well as the funding and stages of the roadmap. But more works needs to be thoughout for the development aspects and in a sense privacy within the system compilation and dissemination of access to this technology. Perhaps Information is enconded for certain agents and the companies can provide keys to access to particular parties through access measures. Whether is regulatory compliance, research or financial.
